abstract: Provides the top-level entry point for the app.
overview:
## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate] provides an implementation of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate/main()] method so that it can serve as the main entry point for a UIKit app. The system calls the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate/main()] method to launch your app; you never call it yourself. You can have exactly one entry point in your app, which you mark with the `@main` attribute.

# main()

**Type Method**

Provides the top-level entry point for the app.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency static func main()
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate] provides an implementation of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate/main()] method so that it can serve as the main entry point for a UIKit app. The system calls the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIApplicationDelegate/main()] method to launch your app; you never call it yourself. You can have exactly one entry point in your app, which you mark with the `@main` attribute.
title: main()
